newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt pound o/n, one-week rates fall.
newsitem.headline: Egypt pound o/n, one-week rates fall.

text.p: Average overnight interbank rates on the Egyptian pound fell on Wednesday in a slightly liquid private-sector market to between eight and 8-3/4 percent from Tuesday's range of eight and 8-7/8 percent, bankers said.
"We might see more liquidity tomorrow due to rejected bids at today's 91-day t-bill auction," one banker said. The treasury has offered bills worth 1.3 billion pounds ($300 million).
One-week rates also fell to between eight and 8-3/4 percent from 8-1/4 and nine percent, the bankers said.
The bankers said that public-sector banks kept their official minimum lending rate steady at 10-1/2 percent.
